# Introduction
The "SimpLin" package is a simple linear regression and outputs estimated regression coefficients, standard errors, $95\%$ confidence intervals, residuals, and predicted values as a list. It is implemented with Rcpp.

```{r setup}
library(SimpLin)
```

## A simple example
```{r}
# Set random seeds
set.seed(26)
# Generate random values
x <- rnorm(100)
# A simple linear function added disturbing term
y <- 1 - 1* x + rnorm(100)
# Call the function
output <- SimpLinR(x, y)

# Print results
print(output$coefficients)
print(output$std_err)
print(output$ci_95)
print(output$residual)
print(output$predicted)
```

## Visualization
```{r}
# Draw scatter points
plot(x,y,  
     main = " Scatter plot of x and y",
     pch = 10, col = "blue")

# Add the regression line
abline(a = output$coefficients[1],
       b = output$coefficients[2],
       col = "red", lwd = 2)

```
